There are four climate seasons in Sri Lanka; the South-West monsoon (‘Yala’ season) operates from May to September, bringing rain to central highlands, southern and western parts of the country, whilst the North-East monsoon (‘Maha’ season) lasts from December to February, bringing rain into the northern and eastern parts of the country. Sri Lanka is an agricultural country whose agricultural activities are mainly carried out in the ‘Yala’ and ‘Maha’ seasons.
